Explanations about Options.-h(M):
Show all output fields automatically scaled to shortest three digit unit and
 display the units of print out. Following units are used.
Explanations about Options.-s(M):
Continuously display the result delay seconds apart. You may actually specify any
 floating point number for delay using either . or , for decimal point. usleep(3)
 is used for microsecond resolution delay times.

Explanations about Options.-c(M):
Stop after sending count ECHO_REQUEST packets. With deadline option, ping waits for
 count ECHO_REPLY packets, until the timeout expires.

Explanations about Options.-f(M):
Force immediate halt, power-off, or reboot. When specified once, this results in an
 immediate but clean shutdown by the system manager. When specified twice, this results
 in an immediate shutdown without contacting the system manager. See the description of
 --force in systemctl(1) for more details.

Explanations about Options.-a(M):
Show accumulated I/O instead of bandwidth. In this mode, iotop shows the amount of
 I/O processes have done since iotop started.
